title: 5 Things To Know: July 1, 2025
content: Five things to know ahead of today's opening bell. Stablecoin issuer Circle has applied for a national trust bank charter. If the Office of the Controller of the Currency grants that request, Circle would be able to offer custody services to institutional clients for assets, which could include representations of stocks and bonds on a blockchain network. Boeing's Chief Financial Officer Brian West is stepping down effective August 15th. He'll be succeeded by former Lockheed Martin executive J Malave. West will stay on as advisor to Boeing CEO. Shares of Robin Hood coming off a nearly 13% gain yesterday. That stock is higher once again this morning after the company rolled out tokenized shares of Open AI and SpaceX to users in Europe. We're going to talk more about these new products coming up in the 8:00 a.m. Eastern Time hour. And NASA's live programming including rocket launches and spacewalks will begin streaming on Netflix this summer. Financial details of that deal have not been disclosed. And according to a court filing, President Trump and Paramount Global are in advanced settlement negotiations to resolve a law a lawsuit where Trump accused CBS of deceptively editing a 60 Minutes interview with then Vice President Kamala Harris. The President has been looking for Paramount to pay $20 billion. A mediator reportedly floated a potential payment of about $20 million. Paramount is set to hold its annual shareholder meeting tomorrow.
summary:
Stablecoin issuer Circle has applied for a national trust bank charter, a move that, if approved by the Office of the Controller of the Currency, would enable them to offer custody services for institutional clients, potentially including tokenized stocks and bonds on a blockchain. This highlights a growing trend of traditional financial structures intersecting with digital assets.

In corporate leadership news, Boeing's Chief Financial Officer Brian West is set to step down on August 15th. He will be succeeded by J Malave, formerly an executive at Lockheed Martin. West will remain involved with Boeing as an advisor to the CEO, ensuring a smooth transition.

Financial technology firm Robin Hood saw significant gains, with shares climbing nearly 13% yesterday and continuing to rise this morning. This surge follows Robin Hood's introduction of tokenized shares of prominent companies like Open AI and SpaceX to its European user base, signifying an expansion of their product offerings and market reach. Additionally, NASA's live programming, including rocket launches and spacewalks, is slated to begin streaming on Netflix this summer, though the financial terms of this partnership remain undisclosed.

Finally, a high-profile legal dispute between President Trump and Paramount Global is reportedly nearing a settlement. The lawsuit stems from Trump's accusation that CBS deceptively edited a 60 Minutes interview featuring then-Vice President Kamala Harris. While Trump initially sought $20 billion, reports suggest a mediator has proposed a $20 million payment. Paramount is also scheduled to hold its annual shareholder meeting tomorrow, amidst these negotiations.

key_points.text: Stablecoin issuer Circle has applied for a national trust bank charter.
The application is with the Office of the Controller of the Currency (OCC).
If granted, Circle would be able to offer custody services to institutional clients.
These custody services could include representations of stocks and bonds.
The assets would be represented on a blockchain network.
Boeing's Chief Financial Officer Brian West is stepping down.
Brian West's departure is effective August 15th.
J Malave will succeed Brian West.
J Malave is a former Lockheed Martin executive.
West will stay on as an advisor to the Boeing CEO.
Shares of Robin Hood experienced a nearly 13% gain yesterday.
Robin Hood's stock is higher once again this morning.
Robin Hood rolled out tokenized shares of Open AI.
Robin Hood also rolled out tokenized shares of SpaceX.
These tokenized shares were rolled out to users in Europe.
More discussion on these new products is scheduled for the 8:00 a.m. Eastern Time hour.
NASA's live programming will begin streaming on Netflix.
NASA's programming includes rocket launches.
NASA's programming also includes spacewalks.
The streaming on Netflix will commence this summer.
Financial details of the NASA-Netflix deal have not been disclosed.
President Trump and Paramount Global are in advanced settlement negotiations.
The negotiations aim to resolve a lawsuit.
Trump accused CBS of deceptively editing a 60 Minutes interview.
The 60 Minutes interview was with then Vice President Kamala Harris.
President Trump had been seeking $20 billion in the lawsuit.
A mediator reportedly floated a potential payment of about $20 million.
Paramount is set to hold its annual shareholder meeting tomorrow.
